title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The first round of the hiring process typically involves a phone interview with a recruiter or hiring manager. This is often used as a screening tool to assess the candidate's skills, experience, and overall fit for the position. During the phone interview, the interviewer may ask a range of questions related to the candidate's background, work experience, and interest in the role. If the candidate is successful in the phone interview, they may be invited to a second round panel interview. This type of interview typically involves a group of higher-level team members.
Interview Questions: 1. Can you describe a specific project or accomplishment that you are particularly proud of? 2. How do you handle difficult or challenging situations in the workplace? 3. Can you tell us about a time when you had a disagreement with a coworker or manager, and how you resolved it? 4. How do you prioritize and manage your tasks and responsibilities? 5. Can you describe a time when you had to learn a new skill or technology quickly in order to complete a project? 6. How do you approach working with a team? Can you give an example of a successful collaboration you have been a part of? 7. Can you tell us about a time when you made a mistake or faced failure, and how you learned from it?

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: I was initially contacted via email by the hiring manager, and was given the opportunity to schedule a first interview via zoom. It went really well, and it was a mix of typical questions and conversations about the position and ourselves. At the end of this interview the hiring manager she told me about another supervisor on site, and started the process to set up my next interview with them. My second interview was also over zoom, and it was a similar good experience to my first interview. About an hour after this interview the first hiring manager emailed me inquiring about about 3 references they could reach out too. I sent the contact information, and within about a week, she emailed me again asking if I could meet for 15 min over zoom that week. Not long after the meeting started she let me know the feedback from my interviews and offered me the position.
Interview Questions: What a time that your came up with a creative solution for a difficult problem.

title: Staff Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
1. HR screening phone call
2. Phone interview with project manager
3. In-person interview with the hiring manager followed by a tour of the lab.
4. Offer

Very straightforward and quick process. Precise interview questions made it easy to know what the interviewers were looking for.
Interview Questions:
- Tell me about yourself.
-What's your ideal work environment?
- How to you handle conflict in the workplace?
- Walk me through how you prioritize tasks and plan your week to maximize your productivity.
- What experience do you have with the skills and techniques listed on the job description? Can you give me some examples?
- What are your long-term career goals and how do you see this position helping you to reach those goals?
- Can you provide references that can speak to your scientific knowledge and technical skills?
- Are you planning on pursuing a PhD in the future?
- Tell me about a favorite class or two you took while earning your degree and give me a brief overview of what you learned in them.
- Are you comfortable with typical lab calculations such as calculating dilution schemes for buffer preparation?
- Can you give me details about a time you designed an experiment that demonstrates your ability to plan and perform experiments, troubleshoot any issues, analyze the data, present your findings, and outline your next steps based on your conclusions?
- What software, databases, and/or programming languages do you have experience with? Are you familiar enough with these to perform them routinely for this role without direct supervision?
- Can you describe your experience(s) with writing manuscripts? Grant proposals? IRB protocols?
- How familiar are you with drafting and adhering to strict budgets?
- What do you like to do in your free time?
- What publication has this lab produced that had the largest impact on your decision to apply to this position?
- Do you have any experience with presenting your research at an organization level and/or at a conference?
- If I offered you this position, what can I expect to see you achieve in the first 3 months?
- Down the road, if I determine that there is a budget surplus, briefly describe what research project or set of experiments would you propose that would advance our lab group's understanding of our current research efforts.
- When would you be able to start?
- What is your salary expectation?
- Will you have trouble passing a background check?

Interview Questions: Tell me about a time.. difficult situation/what was the solution/disagreed with a coworker or boss

title: Staff Research Associate I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Educational, provided guidance and helped me find the right role for me after finishing college. I was new to interviewing and it was a  casual and comfortable chat with all the right questions to help me find what I wanted.
Interview Questions: What aspects will you bring to the role?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straightforward and not too hard. Went through several rounds of interviews and had to talk to lab coworkers and clinical research manager and primary investigators, and more. Questions weren't super technical, they more just wanted a feel for my personality and not necessarily my expertise.
Interview Questions: Strengths and weaknesses, why research and not industry

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: The interview was conversational and scenario-based in nature. I found that the interview was pretty low-stress and a regurgitation of my resume and cover letter. My advice is to demonstrate enthusiasm, zest, and great attention to detail.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself.
What would you if patient did x, y, a? (Ethics)

title: Junior Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions: It was over zoom and I was asked to tell a little bit about myself and answer some classic interview questions about why I would be a good fit for the position or to speak about a past experience
Interview Questions: Tell me about how something on your resume taught you how to collaborate

title: Staff Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, got a response a few weeks after, spoke to a member of the lab who introduced themselves, the lab's research focus, and the expectations for the job position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself & your research experience.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: Pretty simple questions, not too many technical questions. Baseline questions that could be asked anywehre else (strengths, weaknesses, how you stay organized, mistakes you've made,  how you deal with stress etc)
Interview Questions: strengths, weaknesses, how you stay organized, mistakes you've made,  how you deal with stress etc)

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Francisco in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews. First was a phone call with the hiring manager and second was a video interview with the director of the study/department. After a week, I received an email with an offer letter.
Interview Questions: What experiences do you have that are applicable to this role?

title: Research Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quite short for me as I was searching for a summer research internship. The researcher I would be working for called me to ask me a few questions about myself and about the position.
Interview Questions: Can you tell me about yourself?

title: AHT Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: Over the phone interview. I interviewed with 3 different veterinarians. It went well. They asked about my past history.  They asked about how much I made at my current salary.
Interview Questions: Why Would you chose ucsf?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Multiple interviews, one on one with multiple people. I had three interviews total with 4 different people in the team. It would take about 3-4 days to hear back from the employers.
Interview Questions: "Where do you see yourself in 3-5 years?

title: Senior Children's Health Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (Oakland, CA) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: A first one-hour meeting with department director, followed by three one-hour panels with various internal stakeholders, and then a follow-up one hour meeting with department director and four-hour writing exercise.
Interview Questions: A high focus on diversity and representation in writing for the UCSF children's patient community.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: The professor scheduled three online meeting in a row, with herself, her lab members and herself and just her lab members. They were very nice and friendly. The professor described their lab work for me and told me what I am supposed to work on in her lab.
Interview Questions: How have you heard about the position

title: Staff Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online through the job portal.
Received interview invite directly from a the PI of the lab I applied to. Interviewed by PI which went great. He asked for two references.
I was told to wait until the PI can get approval from HR. Never heard back from either the PI or HR
Interview Questions:
What’s your future plan?
Why this position?

title: Staff Research Associate II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: After my 40 minute interview with the principal investigator, I was asked to provide references.  I never heard back even though I followed up multiple times. I was basically ghosted which is very unprofessional.
Interview Questions: What is your research experience

title: Medial Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: I haven’t taking it I’m not sure why this is asking me and all I’m trying to do it look at a MA salary.  It’s making me go through this for that.
Interview Questions: What are Your strengths and weaknesses

title: Director of Graduate Education and Accreditation Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of one committee interview with six people, including several faculty members, that lasted an hour. I came back for the second interview , which was a one-on-one interview with the chair of the department.
Interview Questions: What is your curriculum development experience?

title: HR Generalist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received an email from the hiring manager a week later for a phone screen.  After the phone screen, she scheduled a group interview which included four other HR Staff.  After the group interview, I was scheduled to speak with the Director, which was a fairly easy and quick conversation.  However, after three follow-up emails, I was ghosted by the hiring manager after promising to let me know about their final decision.  After all those times I spent interviewing for the position, the hiring manager didn't have the decency to send me a courtesy email that I had been rejected.  You'd think that would be the respectful thing to do. After two follow-up emails and zero response, I moved on and accepted another offer.
Interview Questions: How do you manage your time and priorities?

title: Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: Casual and friendly people decided to help me out with setting up a great interview. Everybody was very nice and kind and it was great, some things could improve as well.
Interview Questions: What is your wet lab experience?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: Multiple rounds, first is a phone interview, followed by 2-3 zoom interviews. They are pretty straight forward interview questions. I think they do really look for people with specialties in their specific research field.
Interview Questions: How does your past experience apply to the research we do here?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews from a specialist in lab and PI, mostly going through CV, PI had a lot of technical questions. It took around 3 hours in total, but very valuable experience.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about your research experience. 
Tell me about how transcription works.

title: Anesthesia Resident Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: Got automatic interview since I was a medical student here. Otherwise you apply through ERAS. Get an invite, the. Try and quickly sign up for open interview slots once invited to interview.
Interview Questions: Describe difficult situation and how you dealt with it. If you’re in OR, and reach conflict with surgeon, how would you respond?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: went through a recruiter, so the application and interview process was not complicated. My recruiter was very responsive and clear about how the interview process was and they would screen me before I got trained and was assigned to a department
Interview Questions: general behaviour/situational questions; want to see how customer service skills are

title: Web Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at UC San Francisco in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions:
-Contacted by an internal recruiter about job opening.
-30 min video call with internal recruiter to talk about overview of position/team and salary expectations. Very relaxed. Provided resume and cover letter afterwards. (2 days later)
-Hiring manager reached out to schedule an interview. (2 weeks later)
-30 min interview with hiring manager. (1 day later)
-Assigned skills assessment to be completed in 2 days. Included: copy writing (~3-5 sentences), HTML formatting in MailChimp newsletter. (4 days later)
-Told I was not chosen to move forward to the next stage after I sent a follow up email. (~1.5 weeks after skills assessment submitted)
Interview Questions: Tell me about your past work experience.

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was excellent, they just ask general interview questions. I was internal hire so it was really easy since I already knew them.  THey asked me about some sceniors, my experience as UC employee
Interview Questions: Are you flexible with hours that you will be working here

title: Bioinformatics Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: I had several interviews over video call. First one was with the principal investigator then the following ones were with other lab members. During the interviews I mostly talked about resume and skillset / experience as well as future plans
Interview Questions: What are your future plans?

title: CRC I Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: 3 interviews, phone screen w manager, zoom w manager, team interview. very nice friendly ppl in general. standard interview questions such as what are you passionate about, tell me about a time..., inclusion and diversity..
Interview Questions: What does inclusion and diversity mean to you?

title: Bio Statistician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: The interview has three rounds, the process is okay, not very hard. But there will be a take-home assignment for everyone and it seemed to play an important role in the result.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a difficult project that you worked on.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: 30 minute interview. Asked for experiences and clinical exposure. More of a conversation than an interview. Interview with clinical research coordinator and then the principal investigator. Overall, not too difficult of an interview.
Interview Questions: 1. Describe a time you were a leader.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions:
Straight forward, behavioral questions. Quick turn around between interview and human resource contact. Onboarding was thorough and worthwhile. 
Straight forward, behavioral questions. Quick turn around between interview and human resource contact. Onboarding was thorough and worthwhile.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and your desire to work at UCSF?

title: Grants and Contracts Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: Typical questions. Met with a few people on team I would work with.  Nice people asking some similar questions and got offered job on the following day by email and phone.
Interview Questions: What did you like about your last job?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview had quite a few questions (experience, behavioral, compatibility). The interview was not time specific which gave flexibility but can go either way. I will only sample a few questions below. It was a great experience overall.
Interview Questions: Tell us a little bit about yourself?

title: Web Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Straight to the point. Asked me questions related to the skills needed for the job and my experience with them. We talked about my skills and experiences in my former jobs.
Interview Questions: How do you approach web dev?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview first and then department interview ! 3-5 people in a group! They asked two same questions to everyone! Also we did one min to introduce self. No need to ask questions at the end.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your self

title: HIM Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Easy and very informal. Ability to ask questions. Goof impressions overall. Friendly and professional. You will get the feel for what you can expect. Very clear about what is expected of you and how the process will take place
Interview Questions: Plans in five years and prospective

title: Admin Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: First, we had an interview over the phone. Then, we had an in person interview. I had 1:1 interviews with several different individuals who I would work closely with - this took about an hour.
Interview Questions: You cannot get a prompt response from someone you are working with - what do you do?

title: Junior Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: It was straightforward, where have you worked? why are you leaving your current position? where do you see yourself in 5 years? They are receptive to applicants who see this position as a stepping stone.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5-years?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: Very well organized, efficient, and professional. Interview questions are both behavioral and situational. Great process, and really passionate staff.  There were multiple rounds of interviews with managers and other staff on the floor. Emphasis was placed on the community as a whole.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult situation and how you handled it.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: 2 rounds of interviews, followed by a reference check. The whole process took around 1 month. Due to Covid-19, the process took place entirely online. I applied using their website portal, and they reached out around 10 days after I submitted.
Interview Questions: They asked about relevant experiences

title: Post Doctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quite long, in addition to the application there were interview with 8 faculty members, each of them was thoughtful and warm and offered feedback throughout. Although the questions that were asked were challenging, I enjoyed the interviews and grew just from that experience.
Interview Questions: Questions related to research plans and greater impact.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: 3 interviews; asked behavioral questions, about previous roles, challenges I anticipate, usage of RedCAP, other platforms. My previous experience working with patient recruitment, data analysis, manuscript writing. Asked about my favorite parts of previous roles. Other 2 interviews more casual (about my previous experience, major, school, etc).
Interview Questions: What did you learn from your previous position?

title: Reprographics Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: Only 1 interview. The position requires a lot of on the job training so my interviewer just wanted to make sure I could work independently and was up to the training/learning.
Interview Questions: What is your experience in customer facing roles?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions:
First interview:
-40 min zoom presentation 
Second interview - Lab visit : 
-Full day of 1 to 1 30 min interviews with different 
scientists.  
-1hour presentation of the work that I was current doing.
- Lunch with other postdoctoral fellows
- Dinner with the PI of the group that I will be working on
Interview Questions: What are your future aspirations?

title: Energy and Utility Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: Was interviewed by six people, each from a different department. Each person asked one generic question and then more specific towards their specialty (Water, engineering, electricity) (why do think I'm a good fit? Tell us about yourself? etc.). Overall, they were very nice and understanding and did not pressure me if I didn't know much about a specific subject.
Interview Questions:
why do think I'm a good fit?
 Tell us about yourself?

title: Education Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: Very thoughtful and the initial zoom video link went well. UCSF is very prompt and thorough. UC schools are a great institution at the forefront of research. UCSF is a very innovative institution with transforming curriculum and courses. It is a great opportunity to expand the education and support in greater research.
Interview Questions: What is your work style?

title: Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: The interview was great. I appreciated the kindness shown to me by the hiring team and they made certain that I had everything I needed and was amply prepared.
Interview Questions: Mainly asked about previous experience.

title: Research Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had one initial interview. It was through Zoom due to the pandemic and for the first call we had our cameras off.   They asked a few questions you would expect. But they also asked a few 'scenario' questions where they gave a scenario and I had to give an example of how I would handle that situation.
Interview Questions: If hired what will you do in the first 90 days and the first 6 months?

title: Communications Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at UC San Francisco in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had an initial interview with one of the staff asking pretty simple questions lasting about 30 mins. I initially came across the job posting on a job board which required an email to be sent to someone. After the interview, I was informed that I had to apply through the USCF career site. I was also given an exercise to complete within 24hrs. It is interesting that I was receiving email updates concerning the job application and then got ghosted. I one day logged onto the careers portal to see that I had been scheduled for an interview when no one had even reached out to me concerning a 2nd interview. My status later changed to Under Review a few days later and eventually, No Longer Under Consideration.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience working with non-profits.

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: two rounds of interviews. first is to get a good feel and second is with higher up staff. everyone is very nice and I encourage you to strike conversation and ask questions yourself. they are open to you going on about your own experiences and often repeat questions because they have set questions, so try and get creative and not repeat. prepare with typical questions on the internet and be prepared to share why you are passionate about the job and why you specifically make a good fit for the job.
Interview Questions: How do you prefer to work?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator I Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: Went in person after a phone call interview. Really easy going - some situational questions, some behavioral interview questions and overall a relaxed atmosphere. Staff was super helpful, interview was about an hour long.
Interview Questions: How do you work under stress?

title: Assistant Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of two rounds- one with my supervisor and another with the team of physicians and manager I would be working with. The first interview was lengthy- it felt like they had already decided on hiring me (and this is true for most UCSF positions) with the second interview feeling more like a formality.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: very chill, because they knew me before hand and I had worked there a long time ago.  I didnt see the point in posting this, but glassdoor requires it.  Overall, most researchers are pretty chill, if they did not think you deserve to be there they would not offer an interview
Interview Questions: Why would you work here?  You could open a tech company and make $170 million dollars in a year.

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a series of calls with the various stakeholders that I would actively interact with in the project and my direct supervisors. I thought that was thoughtful.
Interview Questions: Why are you the perfect fit for this role? What prior experience that you have makes you the ideal candidate for this role?

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at UC San Francisco in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very informal as it was for a contract position paid by Covid funds.  People were very nice and welcoming.  Although it wasn't a dream job, the people made it worth it.
Interview Questions: Talk about my experience and what I can bring to the team.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a phone call that discussed my background, interests in the lab/research, experience, what I'm looking for in my next job, and career goals. It was a standard interview.
Interview Questions: Q: Why are you interested in working for this lab?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Over the phone interview with uninterested interviewer. You will get frequent pauses and hear typing the entire interview. Variety of questions related to the job and your personality. Did not take the time to see how candidate felt about the job as explained by the interviewer. Very broad questions. Did not go into specifics about the type of condition being researched.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in breast cancer research?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview was over Zoom due to CoVID. I met with a hiring manager and the PI for the lab. The PI was mainly the one to ask me questions to see how I would fit in with the team. The interview was good, other than some odd ball questions they had.
Interview Questions:
Q: What are your strengths and weaknesses for this position? 
Q: How did you work in an environment with a difficult team member?

title: Practice Coordinator II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Great staff and facility. Highly recommended. I enjoy my team and coming to work everyday! Patients will be patients but it  Feels very much like home and lots of room to grow.
Interview Questions:
What is your greatest strength and weakness?
If I called all of your references what would they all say about you?
How do you handle conflict?
Multitasking

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions:
1. First-round is a  ZOOM video interview. The PI, current statistician, and research coordinator introduced their team and project. Ask you to introduce yourself, research interests, and briefly explain some statistical concepts (linear regression, data cleaning, etc).
2. The second round is a coding test. Gave a de-identified file to use R or SAS to analyze it. Interpret the results.
Interview Questions:
1. Why you want to work in UCSF
2. Level of using R
3. What regression model will you use to analyze when you have multiple predictors.
4. What are your strengthens and limitations?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interviews were not hard, mainly questions that you can expect. However there were almost 7 interviews, each with different staff member. Apparently everyone on the team wanted to talk to me but they each have different schedule so the entire process took nearly 3 months, and some of the interviews were a bit repetitive, just answering the same questions to different staff members. They were really nice and polite but I felt that my time was not being respected. In the end I just decided to let go the opportunity because I couldn't wait for any longer.
Interview Questions: strength, weaknesses, tell me about your xxx experience, this job requires X and Y experience but you don't have it, how do you think you'll make up for this.

title: Research Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had a group interview with 4 members of the team.  They asked relevant questions which related to the scope of the work and allowed me to ask the same
Interview Questions: What are your work goals?

title: Dentist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: Easy one-day interview with a 20 minute interview with a faculty member and separately with a dental student. We also had a tour of the facilities. We also had to read a dense essay and write a reply.
Interview Questions: Why dentistry?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: As an overseas candidate, I was interviewed online. The professor and laboratory staff were very friendly. The selection process was fair. I attended three interviews and described about my academic background and my future goals.
Interview Questions: Questions about my academic and research background.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Typical interview process. There was a quick phone call and then an in-person interview.

The in person process was drawn-out and confusing for me. The questions asked during the interview sometimes seemed nonsequitur.
Interview Questions: How would you rate your intelligence? (Using a scale of my own choice)

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at UC San Francisco in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward, multiple interview processes with at pretty quick follow ups by email.  Asked about what relevant experience, education background, what work I am looking to do, and what pay I am interested in
Interview Questions: What experience I had that was relevant

title: Associate Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had an interview through skype call and an on site visit with the hiring manager. Mostly talked about previous work experience, discussed future goals and details about the job profile.
Interview Questions: Q: Relevant work experience, short term and long term professional goals.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral and situational questions, two phone interviews and two video interviews with HR and management. Entire process takes a few months and is very well organized. Management is extremely professional and friendly.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation when you disagreed with a coworker and what did you do?

title: Assistant Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: Applied on the UCSF Brassring website. Heard back from one of the clinical research coordinators in the lab I applied for and received a phone Interview. Waiting to hear back about an in person interview.
Interview Questions: How does this job fit with your long term goals?

title: Division Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions:
I was an internal applicant fo a department I’ve been working in for three years. Process felt long.
Had an initial interview/screening with the department administrator after discussing the role and expressing interest/ applying online. Second round was a two hour interview with six of the individuals this role would be closely working with (individuals I already knew as an internal candidate). Reference request was sent out an completed after this round (although would have preferred this had been sent once interviews had been completed and if they had intended to offer me the role) . Last and final interview was with the medical director.  Job offer was not extended - total time from application was about two months. Ultimately the final interviewee’s judgement call (which was the shortest at 15 minutes) was the most important - although my other interviews went well I did not get the role. Per feedback I was too nervous and the director felt I could not handle a group of physician’s demands.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you were under a lot of pressure

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for the new grad RN program. I was interviewed by two people for 2 different positions. It took about 30 minutes total. There were several simple scenario questions and the rest were experience based (ie. describe a time when you had to deal with a difficult patient etc.) I got a call back 1 week later with an offer.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had to deal with a difficult patient

title: Energy and Utility Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Phone Interview with HR 
Phone Interview with Manager - asked about skills, goals, and introduction to the organization.
In-person interview with 6 people from different departments - each asked 3 questions mostly scenarios questions
Interview Questions: How do you prioritize your work

title: Financial Reporting Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions:
I applied via. UCSF's career website. Over two months later I get a weird survey email asking me about my experience dealing with UCSF's recruiter. Then a while later, I randomly get a very detailed email from a supervisor in the department of the position. 

Instead of a normal interview process, I received 4 interview questions via. email. The Supervisor wanted me answer interview questions via. email. 

Haven't heard from the person or anyone since. Very odd experience...
Interview Questions:
What do you feel you can add to the team?

What is driving your desire to look for a new job?

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, heard back a couple of weeks later, phone interview and then in-person interview a week later. Hiring process is lengthy but worth it. Interview style varies amongst each person interviewing you. Was asked basic questions and basically why I want this position and what skills and past experiences do I possess.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in a couple of years? What past experiences and skills do you have that will help you with this job? Any hobbies? Three words to describe yourself.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was very organized and well put together. Hiring process was extremely informative and all was clear when an offer was given to me.  Overall, the interview process was smooth.
Interview Questions: What are your greatest skills?

title: Practice Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC San Francisco in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: it was a standard application and interview process, interview was relatively quick (around 45 minutes), the interview was with the department supervisor and the department manager, asked around 10-12 questions
Interview Questions: Triage is a major component of this job. As the first point of contact for patients, you will get a lot of different requests and questions you can’t answer. How will you tackle these situations?

title: Operations Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone screening and then came in for an on site interview with 4 team members. After the on site I sent a thank you for interviewing and never received a response back or even a rejection.
Interview Questions: How do you handle working with difficult people?

title: Data Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Submitted resume and application thru UCSF online system.
Received an email from lab PI asked for referral email information.
Lab PI reached out, collected referral and decide to move forward to phone interview.
Onsite panel interview with PI and 2 other students.
Interview Questions: Presentation and an easy coding question.

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (New Orleans, LA) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied for a research coordinator position with UCSF's organization, Advancing New Standards in Reproductive Health. I applied online and was contacted via email within a week of applying. A 30 minute phone interview was conducted. I received an email a week after that to complete a video interview, where I interviewed for almost an hour with four people. I was told I would hear back in about a week. After that week passed and I heard nothing, I attempted to follow up on the status of my application by email. I never received a response from anyone. I feel the organization lacks respect for its prospective employees' time and efforts considering they did not even give me the courtesy of an email saying I hadn't been chosen for the position.
Interview Questions: What are some situations that cause you stress?

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: had a whole lab tour with the lab meeting, 5 back-to-back interviews with members of the lab including a very obnoxious grad student but a kind P.I. so it's hit or miss depending on the lab you join, really.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Research Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Francisco in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quite easy and straightforward. I had reached out to a researcher through email and we had a phone call interview where she asked me questions about my research background, what I was interested in, and how I could contribute to their team.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in research?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was contacted directly by the hiring manager a week later for an interview. This is where it got weird... I was contacted late on Friday afternoon, at 3 pm,  for an interview at 10 am on the following Monday. I was out of town and unable to meet, so I wrote back and attempted to reschedule. The hiring manager never responded. Very strange, and BIG red flags in terms of professionalism. No HR screening (strange for such a large institution), very short notice to interview and/or respond,  no desire to agree mutually on a time to meet, and no response to my request to schedule an interview time that worked for me.  Completely lacking professionalism.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: CRC Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions:
-apply online
-phone screen (about 30 minutes, general questions and behavioral based questions)
-in person interviews (one hour long with each person interviewing- behavioral based and consistent)
-offer given via phone or email
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why you are here today

title: Genetic Counselor Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Francisco in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Met with HR, hiring manager, admin and clinical staff through several rounds of interviews. I had option to do zoom video due to location. References were asked after several rounds on interviews
Interview Questions: General questions on how you work well in a team, in situations where alot is asked from you, why you are interested in genetics

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Met with both Principal Investigators individually to be interviewed and then additionally with the group of CRC's. Everyone asked personal questions, job history related questions, questions about work ethic, team spirit etc.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience leading clinical trials.

title: Staff Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: First, a phone interview. Then, they flew me in, I met with every member of the lab, I went out with them socially. I met with all the senior member of the lab who asked lots of questions.
Interview Questions: Why are you qualified for this position?

title: Postdoctoral Research Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: ZOOM calls with your advisor and potential co-advisors. Sometimes you'll have ZOOM calls with current lab mates. The calls usually last about an hour. They ask about your research experience, and they give you more information about the current research they are working on, and the projects you would be working on.
Interview Questions: Talk about your research experience and how your skills can benefit them?

title: Employment Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: Two-stage process. Applied online through their website. One was an initial phone screening interview that lasted about 15 minutes. The second was an in-person interview which was around 30-40 minutes.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with people who have mental health problems

title: Education Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process for this role was very straightforward and quick.  I did a phone screening then one in-person interview. My panel of 3 were all very friendly which made interviewing much more seamless and comfortable.
Interview Questions: An interesting question they asked me that threw me off a little was the following: who is my favorite superhero? They left it very open-ended.

title: Assistant Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: The application and interview process went smoothly with a quick response for a phone interview and then an on-site interview. But at the end of the onsite interview, my point person never returned for me and had the last person I spoke to tell me I could just go without any follow up. It was very unprofessional.
Interview Questions: How important is having a work-life balance to you?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: I learned about this job through university and contacted the hiring manager directly via email. An invitation for an in person interview arrived a few weeks later and was straight forward and standard.
Interview Questions: Name three things you would want your friend to know about you.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: The process at first was easy. When they gave me the option for a second interview they had to reschedule because the chief had two OR scheduled. With having kids and a job at the same time it was hard to coordinate a time. They were pretty great with giving me a time to meet that worked within my schedule. Everyone seem nice, and since I was told that I didn’t seem interested in wanting the job because of re-scheduling the initial interview that was cancelled on me. The manager calls me and gives me an offer verbally but I ask for a written offer so that I can review it. I emailed the manger twice letting her know I need time to review the offer. Since I didn’t sign the offer and had questions, and counter offered I was declined the position. She blamed me for not showing urgency and not doing research. I feel like when you are wanting a good loyal employee that one shouldn’t be rushed. I can understand what I did wrong by not showing so called “urgency” but she didn’t acknowledge my questions after I reviewed the offer. So it makes you think how they treat employees overall. Maybe it’s a political game or they are just about numbers, and not hiring potentially loyal employees.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: Assistant Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had three interviews for a ACRC position at the Memory and Aging Center. The first one was friendly and one-on-one with the senior coordinator followed by a second where I interviewed with the entire lab team minus the PI and the final interview was with the PI. They asked why I was interested in their projects. It’s helpful to read papers published out of their labs to have a good familiarity with their studies.  I was offered the position and the three interviews were held over the course of two weeks.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in our research?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: We organized a time to meet, and we had a Skype interview. We emailed briefly before to set it up. The interview lasted about 20 minutes because we mostly communicated through email.
Interview Questions: What was your previous experience in the lab?

title: Administrative Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I submit my resume to an online application process, with an option of importing your LinkedIn profile. I received an email as well as a phone message confirming receipt of online application and if interested in the position, a date and time for a phone interview. After phone screening, which lasted 30 minutes, we agreed to a date and time for a 1:1.  

PLEASE NOTE: the online application can take months without any guarantee of a response. Its worth noting that it is always best to get an employee referral. This is a large entity, and this stage of the application is like submitting into a black hole!
Interview Questions: General overview of your resume - tell your story in less that 2-3 minutes. This is the time to perfect your elevator pitch. Come prepared to ask questions as well as do your research on those who will be interviewing you.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: It depends on the department you are going to work with. Every department is different and can vary vastly. It also depends which campus you will be working at and the type of work, whether it's clinical or non-clinical.
Interview Questions: Describe how you would handle a certain type of project and walk them through how you would handle the situation with your team.

title: Social Work Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: I applied a position with 2 openings. I got called in twice for both of interview. I met with a same person with different group of interviewers with “a same exact set of questions” for an interview I. The way they arrange the interview is completely inefficiency.
Interview Questions: How long you will be committed to the position when you got hired?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed via skype. Very relaxed interview, typical questions regarding past employment and applicable experience. Small talk was actually refreshing. Only had one interviewer, the principal investigator of the lab. Not a lot of detail on the lab was given in terms of how many other employees, how large the lab is, what project I would be joining. I was given time to ask questions though, so I covered those.
Interview Questions: Describe what you will contribute to the lab.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: The process was friendly in itself.  However, expect long delays in correspondence. I had the opportunity of interacting one on one with all lab members. The members took me out to dinner at the end.  I enjoyed the lab's collaborative and supportive outlook.  The university itself has many wonderful opportunities to offer.
Interview Questions: How would you summarize the lab's outlook and theme?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: The process took about a month from submitting application to receiving an offer letter. I applied for the position and within a week received an email to set up a Phone Interview. I had a phone interview with the hiring manager. After the phone interview, the hiring manager invited me for an in-person interview to meet with two other coordinators and the director. They asked me behavioral questions and inquired about my previous jobs. The coordinators went over the the daily task of the position and challenges they currently faced.
Interview Questions: What challenges did I come across when working in research?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was finally called about 3 months after submitting applications to several different departments. Hopefully, I will be able to move forward in the hiring process, but there are a lot of other candidates being interviewed as well, I was told.
Interview Questions: What accomplishment are you most proud of in your professional life?

title: Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (Richmond, CA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview last about 30-45 minutes. I was asked mostly behavioral questions. At the end of the interview, they give you time to ask questions about them and time to take in feedback.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time that you had a conflict with a peer or client and how did you handle it?

title: Human Resources Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied on the UCSF website and was contacted a few days later. It was a little confusing because there were multiple HR roles open and so two different recruiters contacted me for the same role but just from different departments. I had two phone interviews for both roles, and was then invited to come onsite for the roles, separately. The way that they interview is completely outdated.  You're sitting in a room with 4-5 people on the other side of the table and each interviewer basically goes down the line and reads a question to you from a piece of paper.  I always thought I was a good interviewer but I was definitely having problems with remembering the questions that they would read to me. It was pretty intimidating. Both of the interviews went that way.  The hiring managers said that they liked me, but it took them almost a month to get back to me to tell me that they hired someone for the roles I interviewed for, but they thought I would be a good candidate for yet another HR role. The recruiter asked if I'd be interested in interviewing for it and I decided to just move on because the thought of going through a third interview panel didn't seem like something that I wanted to do again and it seemed like the hiring process takes forever.
Interview Questions: Tell us how you would help someone with a question about a policy.

title: Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (Oakland, CA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward; three rounds at the Foundation offices. Spoke with multiple team members and the Chief Development Officer. Spent the majority of time with the Senior leader on the team I was interviewing for.
Interview Questions: What contribution would you make to this team?

title: SRA I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interviews will heavily depend on the specific group you are applying to work with, so I am not sure how this information will be useful. However, I can tell you for sure that the interview will be scheduled with each individual PI for a research position and will vary greatly depending  on  their personality.
Interview Questions: What are some of the techniques you performed int he lab as an undergraduate?

title: Assistant Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: Interview was great, very professional, felt very casual. Usually starts off with a skype or phone screen, in my experience it's mostly phone screens first. Then you have an in-person with the recruiter who usually shows you around. Afterwards you either get declined through email, asked for a second round, job offer, or just silence which means you didn't get it.
Interview Questions: Why are you choosing this specific field?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: People were nice, but overall was quite disorganized. The first interview was pleasant, but the second interview  was canceled while we were still in the process of scheduling because the candidate had already been selected.
Interview Questions: How do you identify a tumor as cancerous? How do you determine if a particular drug can treat it?

title: Junior Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at UC San Francisco in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: My phone interview with the PI lasted about 45 minutes. She asked about my research interests, qualifications, and research experience. In addition, she asked me to share my strengths/weaknesses, my work environment preferences, etc.
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable handling animals?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at UC San Francisco in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: They have a fairly standard postdoc interview process. You give a seminar, followed by a 15 min. Q & A. Then you have a 1h meeting with the PI, followed by 30 min. back to back meetings with members of the group. Lunch and dinner were included.
Interview Questions: Pretty standard questions to probe for your thoughts about your field and the lab's research

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: using skype if you are not in CA, asked for the works you have done before in the lab and your interest fields, introduced the project they were doing and asked for some detailed technical questions
Interview Questions: do you have experience with AWS?

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: First is a pre-screen phone interview with the principal investigator's administrative assistant and then an in-person one on one interview with principal investigator -also met members of the lab at this moment
Interview Questions: Name a challenge and how you faced it.

title: Assistant Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: First met with other coordinators who took me to coffee and described the position and the work/life balance. Then met one on one with doctors/senior coordinators from the clinic/research teams. Each asked similar questions mostly about my resume and past experiences. Was about 3 hours long.
Interview Questions: Expand on your college research experiences.

title: Staff Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Fairly straightforwards- apply online, submit CV and Cover letter, brought in for half day of interview with a number of people I would be interacting with. Received offer by email a week or two later, onboarding process was a slight pain but took a day of benefits and privacy review. Some number of online trainings specific to job description and institutional privacy and security. Completed all necessary onboarding in about a week.
Interview Questions: What are your long-term goals, why do you want to work in this lab, explain your past research experiences. Basic discussion of my technical capabilities, mostly conversation to test fit for lab culture and project team.

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Cross functional panel interview. The whole process took the whole day. Everyone was very friendly. 
The questions were typical of an interview. Overall a good experience. I was hired so pretty happy about that.
Interview Questions: Please tell us about yourself?

title: Chemical Hygiene Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: There was a panel of 3 people and the interview lasted for one hour at the EH and S building. Make sure you get there early, the parking was weird, plenty of spots available, just in a weird facilities road.
Interview Questions: What are the controls, hazards associated with using tert-butyl lithium?

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very technical and focused almost entirely on grant writing success and capacity.  Publication history dissected and questioned. Additional focus on participation in professional societies and think-tanks . Not much discussion of teaching.
Interview Questions: What leadership positions have you held in professional societies?

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very straightforward, took about 30 minutes. Just mainly asked about my background in research and relative experiences. They mainly asked questions about things on my resume and to elaborate on what my daily tasks were. They also asked some technical questions about biology but nothing too specific.  Overall, it was not a tricky interview just stayed honest.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC San Francisco in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Met with the lab advisor at a conference, discussed research goals and interests, along with current active projects in the lab. I had a good idea of their research and future interests, so the it was a good fit from the get-go. Recommendation to others is to directly reach out to the PI or head of the lab to discuss projects and interest before the interview.
Interview Questions: What excites you most about working in pediatric research?

title: Human Resources Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Telephone interview went well and I was told if it was up to the interviewer she would select me to move on to the next step of the interview process. I followed up with a Thank you letter and the reply I received was there were other candidates more qualified however my application will be active for future opportunities.
Interview Questions: Do you have any questions for me?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (Raleigh, NC) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, then I was contacted for a phone interview. Overall, the interviewer was pleasant, but I never heard back from the contact, even after emailing. The interview mostly consisted of behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with this lab?

title: CRC Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview was conducted by a representative of the lab. Very engaging and descriptive about the position.  Lab was committed to providing as much detail about their research and projects.
Interview Questions: What are you expectations and goals for this position? What kind of experience have you had in the past that you find applicable to this position?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Started with PI interview, then I had three different interviews with other lab mates. The questions were not too difficult, but I had to know the details of my research experience.
Interview Questions: What is your research background?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at UC San Francisco in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had a wonderful conversation with the PI of the lab and the person who would be directly supervising me. It was warm and informative and I felt highly valued throughout the process. It was overall a great introduction for what turned out to be an incredible role.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to study neuroscience?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen, multiple in person interviews; 2 hours of behavioral questions from 2 separate coordinators but really nice people and very low key. They want people that can commit to around 2 years at least so I could not continue in the process since I wanted to apply to medical school before that. But the experience seems like a great one for someone who wants to go into a healthcare field. There is lots of patient interaction and you work closely with really intelligent and well known physicians.
Interview Questions: Tell me how you prioritize your tasks

title: Research Analyst I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online. About a month later, the hiring manager called me to do a phone screen. A week after that, I had an in-person interview with the hiring manager and another manager, then a panel interview with three prospective coworkers. A month later, I was contacted for three references and a couple of weeks after that I was offered the position.

Both the phone screen and in-person interview were very easy and, despite the second interview being a panel, not nerve-wracking. They asked basic questions ("What's a weakness of yours?" "Why are you interested in this job?") and a few impromptu questions based on my resume.
Interview Questions: How you would respond if a person in authority asked you to do something that is in conflict with an established policy (e.g. HIPAA)?

title: IT Service Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Received an email asking to interview me one month after I applied online. It was an interview with 2 people. They informed me that the position was not permanent.
Interview Questions: How do you stay up to date on current technology and trends?

title: Administrative Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Someone called me at the department and had a phone interview with me. They did not reply to my emails after I followed up. I thought the least they can do it reply back to an email saying if they were going to follow through.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with a mean manager?

title: Research Associate I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job online and was contacted through email almost three months later to set up a phone interview. The phone interview was standard; the lab manager asked about my previous lab jobs and briefly described the responsibilities of the research associate position. If the phone interview went well, the manager would contact you to set up an in-person interview at the lab.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience working with a clinical population?

title: Senior Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online in September 2016 and was invited to the PI's office in late October for a panel interview. Arrived for my interview which consisted of the PI and Co-PIs so three people in total. Each of them asked me a series of set interview questions they had prepared for each candidate so it was definitely structured. Panel interviews can be intimidating so I made sure to try to make each of them smile by closing with a funny. I think they liked it since they offered me the job.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Assistant Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had a 15 minutes phone interview first and then was invited for an in-person interview the following week. I interviewed with four people from the department. I spoke with each person separately for about 15-20 minutes. It felt easygoing and conversational. They spent most of the time telling me about the position. Then they asked about my experience, as well as personal questions about my interests and hobbies. I was there for 2 hours total.  I didn't get the job, but it was still a positive experience.
Interview Questions: What do you like about research?

title: Practice Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Francisco in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was between supervisor and manager and it was an in-person 60 minutes interview. They asked behavioral/STAR questions and mainly focused on how you will deal with conflict and pressure,
Interview Questions: Explain a time where you had a conflict with a coworker and they were right

title: Administrative Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at UC San Francisco in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my resume via the UCSF jobs website. I received an email from the person I would be working for (not my technical supervisor), we coordinated an interview time, and then had a Skype interview. At the end they asked for a few references, who they contacted very shortly thereafter and then I received an offer early the following week. The entire process was pretty quick - i would say 4-5 days.
Interview Questions: What are some things you are good at, and where can you improve?

title: Junior Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied through Academic Recruiting, got an email from the PI, did a phone interview, visited the lab space, interviewed with the PI, interviewed with other PI's in the department and on the floor, was then called and emailed and offered the position and sent an offer letter. Then it took 1 month for onboarding/HR/etc.
Interview Questions: Technique questions, scientific principle questions

title: Fundraising Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: The process was rigorous but it was effective. It began in July 2016 through the end of August 2016, 3 interviews in total. I received an offer mid September with a start date early October.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Easy and standard process.  Two interview sessions, each one hour and in person.  Hiring manager kept me updated.  HR does not notify you on the status of your application.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when a set back occurred, and what did you do to resolve it?

title: Assistant Animal Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I was recommended for the job so I really did not have much of an interview.  I just got hired.  I was recommended by someone who was already working there and I interviewed with the Head of the Department.  He was very impressed with my communication skills and professionalism..
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Francisco
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very simple and straightforward. All questions about past research and leadership experience. The first interview was a phone interview and the next one was on site. After the second interview I received my offer letter.
Interview Questions: Past experience, leadership skills

title: Staff Research Associate II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Francisco (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through UCSF's website, I was contacted for a a phone interview which was followed by a one on one meeting with the Principal Investigator that was hiring me. The one on one interview had to do with my background in research, personal qualities, and desire to work at UCSF. During this interview I was given a tour of lab and facility, I also met with researchers and collaborators.
Interview Questions: Reason for applying as research associate instead of going to graduate school?

title: Database Manager II Interview
